main event: A round object similar to a star in brightness was observed moving in an easterly direction and fading into the sun for 15 minutes on 27 June 1963.
interesting points: The object was first seen 80 degrees above the northern horizon., The observation lasted for a total of 15 minutes., The object disappeared 60 degrees above the western horizon while aligning with the sun., No radar or ground-visual contact was made during the observation., The report later attributed the sighting to a weather balloon released by the U.S. Weather Bureau.
sighted object: a round object similar to a star in brightness
witness description: a civilian, civil service worker at Kelly AFB
